intro: Enterosora subpinnata, commonly known as the narrow-pinnate enterosora, is a species of flowering plant in the family Fabaceae. It is characterized by its bipinnate leaves, which are divided into small, elongated leaflets. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pale yellow or greenish in color. It is native to parts of South America and thrives in tropical and subtropical climates. Enterosora subpinnata is often found in open woodlands and along riverbanks, where it plays a role in soil stabilization and provides habitat for various insects.
